draw.controller.handler

Class ActiveToolHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
      • draw.controller.handler.DrawerMouseAdapter
        • draw.controller.handler.ActiveToolHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class ActiveToolHandler
extends DrawerMouseAdapter
    Adapts mouse events into actions, corresponding to IActionInterface, based on the active tool. This class provides the concrete implementation of an Adapter, that converts incoming events from one interface (MouseListener, MouseMotionListener) into an outgoing sequence of different events on another interface (IActionInterface). Adapters can store transient state as they perform their work. This adapter keeps tract of:
    1. start - Where the initial mouse press event occurred for drag events.
    2. anchorType - If initial press was in an anchor (4/5/6/7) or not (0).
    3. elt - The affected element if the press event occurred over one.
    The events are handled by the given IActionInterface handler.

      • mouseMoved

        public final void mouseMoved(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Responsible for identifying anchorType when hovering over one, or just an ordinary element. This method is critical, since a move event always occurs before a press event happens, and this method ensures that the state for the adapter is properly set up to work.
        Specified by:
        mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
        Overrides:
        mouseMoved in class java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
